title: A new partnership between McAvoy, Zadorov has Bruins defense regaining some bite
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Charlie McAvoy and Nikita Zadorov anchor the Boston Bruins' top defensive pairing, improving the team's recent performance.
The Bruins tightened their defense, winning three games in a row, including a 2-1 victory against Carolina.
Nikita Zadorov's physical play complements McAvoy's offensive contributions, enhancing Boston's defensive strategy.

title: How Jeremy Swayman responded after tweak in Bruins goalie rotation
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jeremy Swayman allowed one goal in his return, leading the Bruins to a 2-1 win over the Hurricanes.
Boston coach Marco Sturm rotated goalies, starting Joonas Korpisalo in consecutive games after Swayman's tough loss to Ottawa.
Despite rotation, Swayman maintains higher save percentage (.896) and goals saved above expected (2.0) than Korpisalo.

title: 9 things to know about Red Sox’ situation entering MLB offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Red Sox have $218.92 million committed for next season, close to the first luxury tax threshold.
Outfielder Rob Refsnyder and pitcher Dustin May will be free agents. Alex Bregman is expected to opt out.
Potential Red Sox free agent targets include Kyle Schwarber, Pete Alonso, and pitchers Dylan Cease and Sandy Alcantara.

title: CBS’s Jason McCourty has seen a lot of the Patriots this season, and even he didn’t see this level of success coming
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Jason McCourty will call his third Patriots game for CBS this season on Sunday.
The Patriots have made significant improvements, with a 6-2 record and QB Drake Maye in the MVP discussion.
McCourty is impressed by Maye's performance, citing his accuracy and outstanding throws observed during games.

title: Patriots reportedly targeting Dolphins pass rusher ahead of trade deadline
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots interested in Dolphins edge rusher Jaelan Phillips ahead of NFL trade deadline, per Dianna Russini of The Athletic.
Phillips has 3 sacks this season and ranks 11th in pressures among edge rushers, showing improvement after an Achilles injury.
Dolphins, at 2-7, have Phillips and veteran Bradley Chubb on trade block, seeking at least a third-round pick for Phillips.

title: Marco Sturm: Bruins’ Mason Lohrei should be angry after getting scratched again
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mason Lohrei is scratched for the third consecutive Bruins game despite his playmaking skills showing promise.
Coach Marco Sturm advises Lohrei to use his benching as a learning opportunity to improve his defensive skills.
The Bruins' defense improved with Lindholm's return and Zadorov joining McAvoy, leading to fewer goals against.

title: 5 things to know about Falcons before Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Falcons enter Sunday's game against Patriots with a 3-4 record and a key performance from Bijan Robinson.
Michael Penix has struggled in outdoor games, completing only 53.1% of passes and has a 65.5 passer rating.
Falcons' defense ranks second in yards allowed and features a strong secondary led by cornerback A.J. Terrell.

title: Pair of former Red Sox save Dodgers to force Game 7 of World Series
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mookie Betts and Kiké Hernandez helped the Dodgers win Game 6, forcing a World Series Game 7 against the Blue Jays.
Betts hit a crucial two-run single in the third inning, propelling the Dodgers to a 3-0 lead.
Hernandez executed a pivotal defensive play, securing the final out by doubling off a Blue Jays player at second base.

title: Frights and delights: A look at some of Boston’s stand-out Halloween costumes
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: MBTA staff celebrated Halloween by handing out candy in costumes, including Wizard of Oz characters and a 'T princess.'
Boston Police participated in East Boston's Trunk or Treat, spotting SpongeBob SquarePants and a future cadet.
Boston Medical Center showcased NICU babies in costumes like superheroes and Celtics champions, with outfits by nurses and Project Sweet Peas.

title: A winning Powerball ticket remains unclaimed in Mass. — and expires next month
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A $50,000 winning Powerball ticket bought in Marlborough, Massachusetts, remains unclaimed and expires on November 20, 2025.
The ticket was purchased at New Capital Farms Convenience Store for the November 20, 2024 drawing.
Unclaimed prize money will be distributed to Massachusetts' 351 cities and towns if not claimed by the deadline.
